intro: Kneiffia tetragona var. hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid four-angled kniphofia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tall spikes of brightly colored, tubular flowers that range from red to orange. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that form a dense rosette at the base. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and long blooming period make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking ornamental plants.
